title: MS AccessDateValue()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessDateValue()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return a date based on the given string:
SELECT DateValue("May 17, 2017");

Definition and Usage
The DateValue() function returns a date based on a string.
Note:
If the given string does not include a year component, this function will use the current year.
Syntax
DateValue(
string_date
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string_date
Required. A string that represents a date (from January 1, 100 to 
    December 31, 9999)
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return a date based on the given string (without year component):
SELECT DateValue("May 17");

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessDateValue()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessDateValue()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessDateValue()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
